description.content:
Last Updated July 2025

You can use Oracle REST APIs to view and manage data stored in Oracle Supply Chain Management Cloud.

Whether you're experienced with or new to REST, use this guide to find what you need, including:

  • A quick start that walks you through a simple request example.
  • Detailed descriptions for each REST API resource.

item.name: Gets all the scenarios to review the exceptions

request.name: Gets all the scenarios to review the exceptions

description.content: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AssignmentSetName; string; Indicates the name of the sourcing assignment set. This attribute is only applicable for cost scenarios enabled for supply chain cost rollup.
  • CostBookCode; string; Value that indicates the accounting cost book code of the cost scenario.
  • CostBookDescription; string; Identifies the cost book description associated with the selected cost book.
  • CostBookId; integer; Unique identifier for the cost book.
  • CostOrgCode; string; Indicates the cost organization code.
  • CostOrgId; integer; Unique identifier for the cost organization.
  • CostOrgName; string; Name of the cost organization.
  • EffectiveStartDate; string; Indicates the effective date of the cost scenario.
  • RollupGroupDescription; string; Value that indicates the supply chain rollup group that the cost scenario is created for.
  • RollupGroupName; string; Value that indicates the supply chain rollup group name that the cost scenario is created for.
  • RollupScope; string; Indicates the rollup scope of the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioId; integer; Unique identifier for the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioLatestEventDate; string; Indicates the completion date of the most recent activity in the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioNumber; string; User-entered name for the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioRollupscopeMeaning; string; Meaning of the rollup scope of the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioStateMeaning; string; Meaning of the state of the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioStatusMeaning; string; Meaning of the status of the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioType; string; Value that indicates the type of the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioTypeMeaning; string; Value that indicates the type of the cost scenario.
  • StateCode; string; Value that indicates the state of the cost scenario.
  • StatusCode; string; Value that indicates the status of the cost scenario.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds a scenario with the specified primary key.
    Finder Variables
    • ScenarioId; integer; Unique identifier for a scenario.
  • findByCostOrgCostBook Finds exceptions for a scenario with specified cost organization and cost book.
    Finder Variables
    • bindCostBookCode; string; Unique identifier to search a scenario with its cost book code.
    • bindCostOrgName; string; Unique identifier to search a scenario with its cost organization name.
  • findByScenarioNumber Finds exceptions by the specified scenario number.
    Finder Variables
    • bindScenarioNumber; string; Unique identifier to search for a scenario.
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

response.name: The following table describes the default response for this task.

description.content: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

  • CostOrgCode; string; Indicates the cost organization code.
  • CostOrgId; integer; Unique identifier for the cost organization.
  • CostOrgName; string; Name of the cost organization.
  • EffectiveStartDate; string; Indicates the effective date of the cost scenario.
  • RollupGroupDescription; string; Value that indicates the supply chain rollup group that the cost scenario is created for.
  • RollupGroupName; string; Value that indicates the supply chain rollup group name that the cost scenario is created for.
  • RollupScope; string; Indicates the rollup scope of the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioId; integer; Unique identifier for the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioLatestEventDate; string; Indicates the completion date of the most recent activity in the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioNumber; string; User-entered name for the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioRollupscopeMeaning; string; Meaning of the rollup scope of the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioStateMeaning; string; Meaning of the state of the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioStatusMeaning; string; Meaning of the status of the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioType; string; Value that indicates the type of the cost scenario.
  • ScenarioTypeMeaning; string; Value that indicates the type of the cost scenario.
  • StateCode; string; Value that indicates the state of the cost scenario.
  • StatusCode; string; Value that indicates the status of the cost scenario.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds a scenario with the specified primary key.
    Finder Variables
    • ScenarioId; integer; Unique identifier for a scenario.
  • findByCostOrgCostBook Finds exceptions for a scenario with specified cost organization and cost book.
    Finder Variables
    • bindCostBookCode; string; Unique identifier to search a scenario with its cost book code.
    • bindCostOrgName; string; Unique identifier to search a scenario with its cost organization name.
  • findByScenarioNumber Finds exceptions by the specified scenario number.
    Finder Variables
    • bindScenarioNumber; string; Unique identifier to search for a scenario.
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

item.name: Gets all the messages from the scenarios

request.name: Gets all the messages from the scenarios

description.content: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • ErrorCount; number; Indicates the number of errors for the specific message.
  • MessageDetails; string; Indicates the message details.
  • MessageName; string; Indicates the name of the message reported for the scenario event.
  • MessageSource; string; Indicates the source of the message reported for the scenario event.
  • MessageText; string; Indicates the text of the message in the language of the user submitting the process that generates the scenario event messages.
  • MessageType; string; Indicates the type of message reported for the scenario event.
  • MessageTypeDescription; string; Indicates the description of the type of the message reported for the scenario event.
  • RowCount; integer; Indicates the number of rows affected by the message.
  • ScenarioEventId; integer; Indicates the reference of the cost planning scenario event.
  • ScenarioEventNumber; string; Indicates the number of the scenario event.
  • ScenarioEventTypeCode; string; Lookup code of the source of the message reported for the scenario event.
  • ScenarioId; integer; Indicates the scenario for which the events are created.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds the scenario events messages for a specific event.
    Finder Variables
    • MessageName; string; Identifier for the type of message in the event.
    • ScenarioEventId; integer; Unique identifier of an event for a scenario.
  • filterByScenarioEventNumber Finds the scenario events messages for a specific event.
    Finder Variables
    • Bind_ScenarioEventNumber; string;

(Required) The value of this parameter could be a hash of the key that is used to uniquely identify the resource item. The client should not generate the hash key value.  Instead, the client should query on the collection resource with a filter to navigate to a specific resource item. For example: products?q=InventoryItemId=<value1>
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

Example:
self,canonical

(Required) The value of this parameter could be a hash of the key that is used to uniquely identify the resource item. The client should not generate the hash key value.  Instead, the client should query on the collection resource with a filter to navigate to a specific resource item. For example: products?q=InventoryItemId=<value1>

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key--- ScenarioEventId and MessageName ---for the Scenario Event Messages resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Scenario Event Messages. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Scenario Event Messages collection resource with a filter on the primary key values in order to navigate to a specific instance of Scenario Event Messages.

For example: ScenarioEventMessages?q=ScenarioEventId=<value1>;MessageName=<value2>

(Required) The value of this parameter could be a hash of the key that is used to uniquely identify the resource item. The client should not generate the hash key value.  Instead, the client should query on the collection resource with a filter to navigate to a specific resource item. For example: products?q=InventoryItemId=<value1>

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

This parameter can be used to show only certain links while accessing a singular resource or a resource collection. The parameter value format is a comma-separated list of : <link_relation>

Example:
self,canonical
This parameter restricts the number of resources returned inside the resource collection. If the limit exceeds the resource count then the framework will only return the available resources.
Used to define the starting position of the resource collection. If offset exceeds the resource count then no resources are returned. Default value is 0.
The resource collection representation will include the "estimated row count" when "?totalResults=true", otherwise the count is not included.  The default value is "false".

This query parameter defines the where clause. The resource collection will be queried using the provided expressions. The value of this query parameter is one or more expressions. Example: ?q=Deptno>=10 and <= 30;Loc!=NY

Format: ?q=expression1;expression2

You can use these queryable attributes to filter this collection resource using the q query parameter:
  • AllocationPercent; string; Percent of supply allocated to this source.
  • Automatic; string; Indicates if the item is automatic.
  • CostBook; string; Unique code for a cost book named to indicate the purpose of the cost book.
  • CostOrganization; string; Indicates the cost organization name of the scenario
  • CostProfileCode; string; Unique cost profile code.
  • CostType; string; Indicates the cost type. This can be either a STANDARD or a BUY cost.
  • CostingEnabled; string; Indicates if the cost is enabled for costing
  • FromUOMCode; string; Indicates the UOM code used for UOM conversion-factor calculations.
  • IncludeInRollup; string; Indicate whether an item is included in the cost rollup.
  • ItemCategory; string; Indicates the category of the item.
  • ItemDescription; string; Description of the item.
  • ItemNumber; string; Unique item identifier
  • LowerLevelError; string; Indicates if the message has a lower level error.
  • MessageName; string; Indicates the name of the message reported for the scenario event.
  • OperationDescription; string; Indicates the description of the work definition operation.
  • OperationName; string; Indicates the name of the work definition operation.
  • Path; string; Identifies the path of the circular reference.
  • Plant; string; Indicates the plant of the item or resource.
  • PrimaryProduct; string; Indicates if the item is a primary product.
  • ResourceClass; string; Indicates the class to which this resource belongs.
  • ResourceCode; string; Code that represents the user key to the resource.
  • ResourceType; string; Indicates the type of resource.
  • RollupHeaderLevel; string; Indicates the level at which the cost rollup should pick up the rollup header for processing.
  • ScenarioEventId; integer; Indicates the reference of the cost planning scenario event.
  • ScenarioEventMessageId; integer; Indicates the surrogate identifier for the scenario event messages.
  • SegmentName; string; Indicates the segment name.
  • SourceOrganization; string; Indicates the source organization of the item.
  • SourcingRuleName; string; Indicates the sourcing rule name.
  • SubassemblyComponent; string; Indicates the item number of the subassembly component.
  • SubassemblyPlant; string; Indicates the plant of the subassembly component.
  • SupplyType; string; Indicates the supply type of the item.
  • ToUOMCode; string; Indicates the UOM code used for UOM conversion-factor calculations.
  • WorkDefinition; string; Indicates the work definition name.

This parameter orders a resource collection based on the specified fields.  The parameter value is a comma-separated string of attribute names, each optionally followed by a colon and "asc" or "desc".  Specify "asc" for ascending and "desc" for descending. The default value is "asc".  For example, ?orderBy=field1:asc,field2:desc

Used as a predefined finder to search the collection.

Format ?finder=<finderName>;<variableName>=<variableValue>,<variableName2>=<variableValue2>

The following are the available finder names and corresponding finder variables

  • PrimaryKey Finds a specific scenario event message.
    Finder Variables
    • ScenarioEventMessageId; integer; Unique identifier for a scenario event message.

(Required) The value of this parameter could be a hash of the key that is used to uniquely identify the resource item. The client should not generate the hash key value.  Instead, the client should query on the collection resource with a filter to navigate to a specific resource item. For example: products?q=InventoryItemId=<value1>

(Required) This is the hash key of the attributes which make up the composite key--- ScenarioEventId and MessageName ---for the Scenario Event Messages resource and used to uniquely identify an instance of Scenario Event Messages. The client should not generate the hash key value. Instead, the client should query on the Scenario Event Messages collection resource with a filter on the primary key values in order to navigate to a specific instance of Scenario Event Messages.

For example: ScenarioEventMessages?q=ScenarioEventId=<value1>;MessageName=<value2>
The protocol version between a REST client and service. If the client does not specify this header in the request the server will pick a default version for the API.

If the REST API supports runtime customizations, the shape of the service may change during runtime. The REST client may isolate itself from these changes or choose to interact with the latest version of the API by specifying this header. For example: Metadata-Context:sandbox="TrackEmployeeFeature".

response.name: The following table describes the default response for this task.

description.content: When this parameter is provided, the specified children are included in the resource payload (instead of just a link). The value of this query parameter is "all" or "". More than one child can be specified using comma as a separator. Example: ?expand=Employees,Localizations. Nested children can also be provided following the format "Child.NestedChild" (Example: ?expand=Employees.Managers). If a nested child is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?expand=Employees.Managers" is the same as "?expand=Employees,Employees.Managers" (which will expand Employees and Managers).

This parameter filters the resource fields. Only the specified fields are returned, which means that if no fields are specified, no fields are returned (useful to get only the links). If an indirect child resource is provided (Example: Employees.Managers), the missing children will be processed implicitly. For example, "?fields=Employees.Managers:Empname" is the same as "?fields=;Employees:;Employees.Managers:Empname" (which will only return the "Empname" field for Managers). the value of this query parameter is a list of resource fields. The attribute can be a direct (Example: Employees) or indirect (Example: Employees.Managers) child. It cannot be combined with expand query parameter. If both are provided, only fields will be considered.

Format: ?fields=Attribute1,Attribute2

Format for fields in child resource: ?fields=Accessor1:Attribute1,Attribute2
The resource item payload will be filtered in order to contain only data (no links section, for example).

This parameter specifies dependencies which are fields that are set before and rolled back after generating the response. Generally they are used to preview the effects of an attribute change. The fields specified in this parameter are always set in the resource instance in question. When a child resource collection is requested and the parameter is set, the fields will be set in the parent resource instance before generating the resource collection payload. The value of this query parameter is a set of dependency fields. Example: dependency=ProductId=2

Format: <attr1>=<val1>,<attr2>=<value2>
